title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 510.1 - Background and intent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 510.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) The public's
right to know the process of government decision making and access to documents
and statistics leading to determinations is basic to our society. Therefore, it
is the policy of the Office of Mental Health (OMH) to grant ready access to its
records to the public, consistent with the Freedom of Information

Law. (b) This regulation sets forth
criteria regarding the designation and duties of records access officers and
procedures regarding requesting, granting, denying and appealing access to
records. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 14
ยง
510.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
